channel.title: Bcel Help

item.title: Bcel Help
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

replace the constant:

classGen.getConstantPool().setConstant(lookupUtf8(".jagex.com"), new ConstantUtf8(".myhost.com"))

or, you can load the ‘s1’ object, push the string that equals your host onto the stack, create an ‘INVOKEVIRTUAL’ to the equals() method, add an ‘IFEQ’ and branch it to an IRETURN instruction. make it look like this:

ALOAD_X //s1 object
LDC //your host
INVOKEVIRTUAL // equals() method
IFEQ
ICONST_1
IRETURN

Read full topic

item.title: Bcel Help
item.dc:creator: @ZyztemX ZyztemX
item.description:
@ZyztemX wrote:

Why would you want to do this if you can load applet indirectly and set documentbase url using a stub.
Anyway, you could do multiple things, you could add your own stub class to the jar then invoke setStub before client wants to parse its parameters.
Or you could ofcourse, change the codebase url, by adding a ldc, as Nueb35 said, and getting rid of the documentbase url getter.

Read full topic

item.title: Bcel Help
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

add a ldc which loads the string “127.0.0.1” and remove the invokes which set it to getDocmentBase().getHost().toLowerCase()

item.title: Bcel Help
item.dc:creator: @rsc rsc
item.description:
@rsc wrote:

I need someones help if they would be ever so kind.
I have never used BCEL before, and only just about know how it works.
I know for a fact in da.class, the string s1, is related to the host address, evidence:

    final boolean a(int i1)
    {
        try
        {
            E++;
            String s1 = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase();
            if(s1.equals("jagex.com") || s1.endsWith(".jagex.com"))
                return true;
            if(s1.equals("runescape.com") || s1.endsWith(".runescape.com"))
                return true;
            if(i1 != -1)
                return true;
            if(s1.endsWith("127.0.0.1"))
                return true;
            for(; ~s1.length() < -1 && s1.charAt(-1 + s1.length()) >= '0' && ~s1.charAt(-1 + s1.length()) >= -58; s1 = s1.substring(0, -1 + s1.length()));
            if(s1.endsWith("192.168.1."))
            {
                return true;
            } else
            {
                a(false, "invalidhost");
                return false;
            }
        }
        catch(RuntimeException runtimeexception)
        {
            throw ah.a(runtimeexception, "da.T(" + i1 + ')');
        }
    }

How would I use BCEL to edit this so that it would accept it from any host address.
Could it just set s1 to runescape.com?

Thanks for your time.

Read full topic
